intro: Jasione perennis f. megacarpaea, commonly known as the large-seeded everlasting. This plant is a flowering perennial belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, pinkish-purple flowers. It produces distinctive, large, persistent seed capsules that give it its common name. The foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in well-drained, sunny soils, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
